headline.main: SOUTHERN NATIONS ROUSED; Combination Against Germany May Follow Brazil's Entry Into the War. STIRRED BY CUBA'S ACTION Guatemala, Bordering on Mexico, Has Best Army of Central Republics. CHILE EXPECTS TO COME IN Reports of German Reservists Crossing the Mexican Border Found to be Exaggerated. Others May Join In. PERU FOR UNITED ACTION. Press Urges Common South American Policy Against Germany. Chileans Expect to Enter War. SOUTH AMERICAN ANGER AT GERMANY Uruguay Press Lauds Our Action. Argentina Deeply Impressed. WORRIED OVER BRAZIL. Germans Based Hopes on South American Field After the War.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, April 22. --Enthusiastic demonstrations were held here today in support of the cause of the United States and the Allies in the war. One hundred thousand people carrying flags marched through the streets singing the...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, April 22. --Enthusiastic demonstrations were held here today in support of the cause of the United States and the Allies in the war. One hundred thousand people carrying flags marched through the streets singing the "Marseillaise" and shouting for the United States, France, and the other Allies. Women threw down flowers upon the paraders from the balconies.
docs.abstract: demonstrations in support of U. S. and Entente Allies; resolution adopted protesting against violation of international rights by Germans and expressing harmony with U. S. and Brazil; sympathy for Allies and Russian revolution

headline.main: 100,000 ARGENTINANS MARCH IN WAR PARADE; Crowds in Buenos Aires Cheer for Allies, Demanding War With Germany.

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 28.--The decision as to whether Brazil will follow up her breach of relations with Germany by a declaration of war will be made by the Brazilian Congress when it convenes on May 3. The administration has decided that it has...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 28.--The decision as to whether Brazil will follow up her breach of relations with Germany by a declaration of war will be made by the Brazilian Congress when it convenes on May 3. The administration has decided that it has fulfilled its duty in decreeing a diplomatic rupture, and that further action lies in the province of Congress.
